intro: Sykesia macrostipula, commonly known as the giant orchid, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter, making it one of the largest orchids in the world. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), which helps it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Sykesia macrostipula is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
